segment.source: Set the Default Power Plan
segment.target: Set the Default Power Plan

segment.source: Set the Default Power Plan
segment.target: Set the Default Power Plan

segment.source: Set the Default Power Plan
segment.target: Set the Default Power Plan

segment.source: Use these instructions to set a default power plan when deploying Windows 8 or Windows Server® 2012 PCs.
segment.target: Use these instructions to set a default power plan when deploying Windows 8 or Windows Server® 2012 PCs.

segment.source: A power plan is also known as a power scheme.
segment.target: A power plan is also known as a power scheme.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This page gives information about manufacturing PCs.
segment.target: This page gives information about manufacturing PCs.

segment.source: To modify a power plans on your own PC, see Power Plans: Frequently asked questions.
segment.target: To modify a power plans on your own PC, see Power Plans: Frequently asked questions.

segment.source: To set the default power plan
segment.target: To set the default power plan

segment.source: On your technician computer, open an elevated command prompt.
segment.target: On your technician computer, open an elevated command prompt.

segment.source: If you want to use a power plan from another computer, import the power plan.
segment.target: If you want to use a power plan from another computer, import the power plan.

segment.source: For example, to import a power plan that is named OutdoorPlan, type the following at a command prompt:
segment.target: For example, to import a power plan that is named OutdoorPlan, type the following at a command prompt:

segment.source: Type the following to find the GUID for all the power plans on the computer:
segment.target: Type the following to find the GUID for all the power plans on the computer:

segment.source: The computer returns the list of available power plans.
segment.target: The computer returns the list of available power plans.

segment.source: The following examples refer to these plans as guidPlan1 and guidPlan2.
segment.target: The following examples refer to these plans as guidPlan1 and guidPlan2.

segment.source: Note the GUIDs that are listed next to the power plans that you want to change.
segment.target: Note the GUIDs that are listed next to the power plans that you want to change.

segment.source: Set the power plan that you want to set as the default as the active power plan.
segment.target: Set the power plan that you want to set as the default as the active power plan.

segment.source: For example, you can use the following command:
segment.target: For example, you can use the following command:

segment.source: where guidPlan2 is the name of the power plan.
segment.target: where guidPlan2 is the name of the power plan.

segment.source: This command can be run by using a custom command in an answer file, or by opening an elevated command prompt in audit mode.
segment.target: This command can be run by using a custom command in an answer file, or by opening an elevated command prompt in audit mode.

segment.source: To confirm that the default power plan
segment.target: To confirm that the default power plan

segment.source: Click Start, and then select Control Panel.
segment.target: Click Start, and then select Control Panel.

segment.source: Click Hardware and Sound, and then select Power Options.
segment.target: Click Hardware and Sound, and then select Power Options.

segment.source: The Power Options Control Panel opens, and the power plans appear.
segment.target: The Power Options Control Panel opens, and the power plans appear.

segment.source: Review each power plan.
segment.target: Review each power plan.

segment.source: Verify that the correct plan is set as the active power plan.
segment.target: Verify that the correct plan is set as the active power plan.

segment.source: The computer shows an asterisk () next to the active power plan.
segment.target: The computer shows an asterisk () next to the active power plan.
